model

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Database

  • public class Database
extends Object
    This is a singleton class that represents the database of the framework. It contains the method to update itself.

    The constructor is private as you must not use it. Instead use the getInstance() method to get the only object of the class (or to create it).

    Author:
    Alexandre Camus
    See Also:
    updates(RuleSet)

      • getInstance

        public static Database getInstance()
        This is the method to get an instance of the class. Use it as shown: Database.getInstance()
        Returns:
        the only instance of the class Database.

        Sets the limits of the fluents and the actions.
        Parameters:

      • getLimits

        public Map<String,Integer> getLimits()
        Gets the limits of the fluents and the actions.
        Returns:
        the mapping between the name of fluents or actions and their limits.

      • addRulesDatabase

        public void addRulesDatabase(List<Rule> rules)
        Adds rules to the database.
        Parameters:
        rules - the rules to add to the database.

        public void setdSet(DSet dSet)
        Sets the domain theory of the database.
        Parameters:
        dSet - the D set of the database to set

      • getDSet

        public DSet getDSet()
        Gets the D set of the database.
        Returns:
        a DSet object representing the D set of the database.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the database under the form of: " DB: Facts: { } Rules: { } ".
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        See Also:
        Object.toString()

      • getRuleSet

        public RuleSet getRuleSet()
        Creates a RuleSet object that represents the state of the entire database (intensional and extensional).
        Returns:
        a RuleSet object containing all the rules of the database.

      • updates

        public void updates(RuleSet events)
        Updates the database when the step cycle asks so. This should be only used by a CycleState implementation.
        Parameters:
        events - the events that have been triggered during the previous cycle.
        See Also:
        DatabaseUpdateState
